intro: Cryptantha flaccida var. minor, commonly known as the slender cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor nutrient conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine pubescence, aiding in water conservation. The species is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
